61eu1NbCRBGExiTFuBS3-Q.text: Very, very disappointed with the quality of food and variety of choices available, especially after waiting for so long for them to open in this location.   I had a split salad and rice bowl with hummus, eggplant etc...  There was no eggplant to be seen or tasted in what they call eggplant side and hummus tasted a lot like yogurt.  Chicken and rice were luke warm. The other add-ons to the bowl were bland too.  The only thing that tasted reasonably well was the lemon tahini dressing and lemonade.  Compared to Yafo (which has a similar "make your own bowl" option), Cava has some work to do in coming up with original flavors and ingredients that would make their offerings worth $10 a dish.   I would definitely choose Yafo over Cava when in a mood for a bowl of mediterranean flavors that are well done snd freshly baked pita bread.

Mvf9IseyYzUdk2q8MMjn7g.text: Simple verdict: does not hold a candle to Yafo. I went with high expectations but was let down by lack of topping options and the flavor of food. Hummus was ehh. Falafel and beef meatballs were cold. Nothing stood out. Everything in my bowl was just okay. I liked the decor and that they served out of staub cast iron. I won't go again.

56ZcrJeNzCzykD23JZfgVg.text: We were lured in by the "hot & new" tag on Yelp. My boyfriend is Middle Eastern and we make it a point to try Mediterranean restaurants near us. We could immediately tell that CAVA is a poor rip off of YAFFO.  The pita was hard and tasteless. The lamb meatballs are tough and bland. The soup is colored water. We paid $30 for 2 meals and 2 drinks. We won't be back.

p5vZkXs_dTRHJlMzg0L0Sw.text: So my BF and I LOVE Cava. We typically go to the one in university .. we've been super excited that a closer location was opening up. We went tonight and it was an awful experience. They barely gave us any rice or lentils (I had to ask 2x for more) p.s I am a small girl and don't eat much but the portions they were serving was not worth the price at all. They were out of almost everything ... we had to wait 10 min for chicken, and never ended up getting other ingredients we waited for. Also, the back counter looked super messy and all the ingredients were mixed together. I understand you guys just opened but it's something to really improve for the future. I don't think I'll be back to this location.

KIe9cfTdjaIiEVNJiZepGw.text: Ahhhhmazing. It's like a Mediterranean Chipotle that doesn't make you feel like crap after! Everything is really fresh and not over salted/seasoned. Nothing is dripping in oil! All of the flavors go well together in whatever combination you get. My new fave quick lunch!

ipmE37HjHEnfidxvxqyDvQ.text: My husband and I came here for a quick lunch. Service was great and the food tasted really fresh. The soda selections are fantastic!

vIdYXxXUUPN48SL0disgIQ.text: At here for lunch and the food was very good.  Well seasoned and nice portion sizes.  The dips and sauces were good and mixed well with the other parts of the meal.  The pita bread was soft yet firm.  Definitely will return.

8Iia25Emxg9g26RK-bj4Jw.text: I had the opportunity of going to this location the food was phenomenal.  I will definitely go back again.

VC7EUcZ9A4mhPB-nuEj3mA.text: Highly recommend for healthy, quick casual dining!  I came with a friend for lunch and even though there were several people in line it moves quickly.  The gal dishing the food was very nice and very helpful explaining the options.  I got the salad, mixed grains bowl with chicken, veggies and hummus-YUM!!  The restaurant is very clean and most items (straws, plates, bowls) seem to be made from recycled materials (bonus points!). I will definitely be back!

m2zGvlxL5YJ80PiFudu9Cg.text: I went around 9 for a quick bite, there weren't many people so the line went fast. The staff was friendly and patient with me as a first-timer. The bowl size was fine, I was full before I finished everything. It would be nice to have more of the dips and on a separate plate. The bowl ended up being a mashup, with some interesting flavors. The beef meatballs had better flavor and texture than the falafel which was too mushy on the inside for me. By the end, salt was the predominant taste and I would probably choose another venue next time. The water spout was out of order on the fountain, so only soda water was available. I opted not to purchase a beverage which didn't help with all of the salt.

juIQZFVJ1UTGKnXS7FJ2pA.text: Tried the new location and arrived when opened on a Saturday. Flavors still good but wondered if we were served yesterday's chicken? Wasn't as good as when we visited university store. Pita bread seemed like it was also from yesterday. Still enjoyed just not overwhelmed.

4cloTeEORW7tNS4cub_yGw.text: Excellent food selections, you can go vegan and leafy you can have greasy, whatever soothes you, the choices are plenty full. This place is good food made well, fresh and fast with reasonable price.

GDom4-jsbDvV9BcISfEVxQ.text: I absolutely fell in LOVE with CAVA once it opened up here in Park Road. Almost every experience I have had here is great, and the food is always fresh and prepared. I most often come during the week, and everything is always ready to go and the staff is awesome. However, I came this past weekend, and my experience was terrible. To start, we got there at opening, and there was a line of people (including me) waiting for them to open the doors on time, which they did not. The employees were different than usual, so this made sense to me. Once we got inside, none of the food was prepared. No proteins were ready, no lentils, etc. I ordered the roasted veggies, my favorites, which were not roasted at all and they were cold, hard, and covered in pepper. I knew they weren't prepared correctly as I have had delicious ones multiple times prior. I had my order placed online, and when I opened my bag, there was no dressing. I told the woman working and she seemed to not care one bit. My mom and I got there at 10:45, and the chicken, lentils, and other proteins were not ready until 11:15. If it opens at 10:45, I expected the food to be ready, and at least not sub par. It seems as if they were running behind and threw out whatever they could. I am very disappointed in this experience, as it was significantly worse than usual. I am glad that was not my first time going here, as I probably would have never returned.

pazveyp8nYiBOPcg9hSOeQ.text: GREAT FOOD!  Build your own bowl to taste for that Day!  Outstanding staff, who were very patient in explaining service. Open environment!   Pickles onions are the Best (homemade taste)!

W6hcx65DRPgwCCOvBpHi4A.text: The staff was so so nice and the food was refreshing, fresh, and delicious! New favorite lunch and dinner spot!

1XJtCTQA0AT_y7mMilvZ9Q.text: I came to CAVA for their free grand opening . Upon entering everyone was really friendly and enthusiastic. The line was super long but it was about 7pm and a free dinner so a little line was ok. I was overwhelmed with the options and I felt pressured to choose what I wanted . It was all in my head not by the employees. I'm really basic when it comes to food so I don't think I took advantage of all the different options and flavors. Nonetheless, I did enjoy my chicken bowl and the spicy hummus was delicious !!! I did get a few sauces on the side because I was scared to mix it all in and not like it . The mixed veggies had a funny taste so I'm positive I didn't like them. The juices were way too sweet for me so I added water . Overall it was good, just not food I would eat normally .

led7VlY-wJ5y_zLE-tijWg.text: Great option for fully customized Mediterranean wraps and bowls. There's plenty of vegetarian options, as well as a full list of dietary compatibility for each item right on the menus which is very convenient. They also have a good selection of special juices, teas, and custom sodas. (Blueberry soda anyone? Yes, it's a thing here.) They were super helpful as it was our first time and willing to let us try pretty much any item or sauce we wanted before making our selections. It's a decent price as long as you maximize your bowl with their unlimited toppings. I wish they offered a few "crafted" (pre-designed) menu options too (for a change of pace from your norm or for those overwhelmed by too many choices), but all said and done, we were very happy with it and definitely would be happy to return.

jUZYy1-ijRLd07KW2GgAXQ.text: That's a place you need to check! They have awesome food, very tasty and spicy! Fast service and friendly faces

cEjGRe5Xayk0zbT4qYbnxw.text: This place has exceptional service. Most places like cava (chipotle etc.) the employees aren't friendly or attentive. At cava it's different. They will make sure you get what you're looking for. They will walk you through your options and do it with a smile on their face. 10/10 recommend

mLdFZLWOqWPCJ4gDmZTFNg.text: I am SO HAPPY that CAVA opened this location. I've been obsessed with it since trying it in the University area! If you're looking for yummy, filling, and healthy "fast food" that is perfect to mash around in a bowl, CAVA is your place. I love mixing the black lentils with supergreens as my base, and it's hard to stay away from the falafel and roasted veggies. Their juices are always on point, as well!

photos.caption: Photo of CAVA - Charlotte, NC, United States

kZ06ucZazTevDR1x-HFfqQ.text: VERY clean spot, friendly people and such good fresh food! The grilled meatballs are so flavorful and juicy. Please also try the Strawberry mint drink!!!! Yassss

fj6YMtaLk1bu01yI-W2iPg.text: After my third visit to Cava, I am more than confident that Cava is my favorite eatery outside the Charlotte area! The food is always extremely fresh and the service is exceptional. I love the many options ranging from a mini pita to a huge salad, all of which are accented with a plethora of yummy toppings.   The servers, especially Demonte (I believe this is his name), are gracious with giving me and my friends as few or many toppings as we request, along with really great recommendations!   I also love the seasonal part of the menu that changes. It offers different vegetables, such as butternut squash and brussel sprouts offered this winter, which makes Cava vegan, whole30 and keto friendly.   It is interesting to note that the water is all bubbly water, not still. I like this little touch to make the experience even more different/better than normal.   Cava, I will be back!

cW-j7Sc-NFNiSToK1J--Eg.text: OMG! I can seriously eat here daily. Everything I have tried is so fresh, filling and like on the healthy side - win, win, win!!!! I usually get a bowl with black lentils and brown rice and greens base then literally any of the spreads. All the spreads are amazing, and you can pick 3 of those! As an Egyptian, i'm quite picky with my falafel, but these are delish and well seasoned!!! The beef meatballs are delicious too. I like to combine sauces, so don't be afraid to get more than one drizzled at the end. I also cannot stress this enough - Get. The. Side. Pita!!!!

_TqphKOBT8dMawm2AfaDng.text: Delicious and quick. Love the atmosphere and the service. Soft open went so smoothly and I'm excited to add it to my staple of places in park road shopping center!

PNcgZG1m9Mb57xB_YfxafQ.text: Great fresh food! Lots of options at fast casual prices. Service is sometimes lacking at busy times as well as cleanliness of the restaurant. Overall good choice and nice option to order on app and pick up on the run.

a9FiX5Ln3sdwGzwcI8_7ag.text: Love this spot for lunch! Healthy options galore. Quick, clean, tasty and very budget friendly!

czlKNRQD92Ng92LxI2v0KQ.text: Best place to grab some tasty Mediterranean healthy food. This is the only fast food that is worth the price. Great staff, good location, great deals.

Dqlc9Hm-YUmz05dcM0zWWw.text: I am so glad we finally have a CAVA nearby. The food was great and the employees were helpful.

YhAOP74tuxOwLzKvqky_dA.text: This was my first trip to CAVA but it won't be my last. Being that it was my first time ,I asked  for a lot of guidance. The woman helping me was super helpful and did not steer me wrong. The food is fantastic but the customer service will keep me coming back.

nsTwf3jm_N1iXPy_qxwzPw.text: Thought Yafo would have some competition, yet I left unimpressed.  Big positive for the  pleasant line members,however, the cashier seemed scattered. Big plus for the beverage options of flavored lemonades and teas, including unsweetened and lightly sweetened.   The food was tepid and not as flavorful as Yafo for me. I have heard some others prefer the University location, so maybe I will try them before I write this chain off.

ZIsQqLMR4l84OdJCicUMOA.text: Delicious and fresh! Cava can cater to any taste pallet. The combinations of spreads, proteins and vegetables were on point. Good portions that are filling, colorful and tasty. Can't wait to come back and have more!!

QDgsQEG47SLzPUOU3yk1LA.text: Delicious and nutritious! I had a grains and greens bowl with half chicken and half falafel. It tastes amazing and I feel great after eating it! Ready to tackle the rest of my holiday shopping!

NTQZJH8Ti2plxQNIvXgBLQ.text: Cava at Park Road Shopping Center is one of my go-to restaurants at least once or twice a week.  It is such a popular spot, and I have learned the best times to show up to avoid busiest times.  The healthy Mediterranean concept food is so very good - as you work your way down the line of food, choices, you are able to customize your meal: my favorite items include the mini pita which I like with hummus, falafel, tomatoes, marinated radishes and feta cheese.  And, the pita chips served warm are a must have item - addictive! The staff are nice and keep the line (at busiest times) moving efficiently. Indoor and outdoor seating is available.

PoCiSM06wmzvX27ikcxBsQ.text: Food was good but super confusing in the ordering process. I wish the employees on the line would have been more helpful. Place is new and clean but idk if I'll go again. Food good but not amazing.

RzJdVBKfNOWpkeK1aNdAHQ.text: Fast and friendly.  Great for a quick snack and better than fast food. The pita chips are excellent. I really like the mini pita.  It's enough to satisfy, if you want to eat light.

mbTAvmZL_TpJBwGVd1ltkA.text: A new location for CAVA at the Park Road Shopping Center make it a convenient locale for some 'healthy' Mediterranean! It's got some different options than the nearby growing competitors of Yafo, but I found that I prefer the flavors of Yafo as well as the serving size for the similar price of a bowl. The service here is always helpful, but it does get crowded quickly as there aren't much indoor seating spaces during peak times. However, it is fast casual so tables open up pretty quickly.  The drinks/juice options at CAVA were very tasty and not overly sweet!

NDgvvvHkrb6JFLhk_3-AKA.text: This is my third experience with CAVA.   I can tell you everytime I have enjoyed it.  There are plenty of choices for people of all ages.  So far I have gone with the grain bowls (rice and other bases you can choose from), and a pita wrap.   The bowls are great when you get some pita on the side and make it a dip and bread combo.          Yesterday I did the pita wrap with falafel.   I Threw some cabbage, tomatoes, cucumbers in there,  also I added a couple of hummus flavors and I had the lady who made my pita at the end choose the dressing.  I think it was a lemon one....And boom, amazing.    The people at the park road location had to deal with grand opening crowds and absolutely crushed it.  They gave each person a separate experience and made the time we waited well worth it.  I would choose this place over a YAFO if I wanted a meal any day.   The park road place has plenty of parking and a great plaza to shop in before or afterwards.  If you haven't had a chance to go here yet, Google the address and go already.

photos.caption: Photo of CAVA - Charlotte, NC, United States. Blueberry lemonade!!!  (Try the apple caramel vanilla , you won&#39;t be dissapointed
Photo of CAVA - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pita wrap!!   With falafel.  So good

GczMzw0tBwPszkKRd1hYGw.text: I hope this place keeps up the good work for the long run. Everyone has been talking about this place; BELIEVE THE HYPE.   This place serves healthy meals: quick, casual and tasty. Think of a healthier/fresher version of Chipotle. You choose your base (greens or grains or both), add proteins and veggies, and choose your sauce. HINT: THE SAUCE MAKE THE DISH - GREAT CHOICE OF SAUCES!  Plenty of parking, conveniently located and clean location. You can order online and skip the lines. I'll be returning for lunch.

NY_AOhR3iSmS5OfhI5eTYw.text: Went here for the first time last night and made it just before the dinner rush (we arrived a little after 6). The staff were really helpful and explained how the menu worked and then my friend and I got grain bowls.   Points for roasted red pepper hummus and eggplant and red pepper hummus. Both were delicious!   They offered either a grain or green or 50/50 bowl or pita options. With a bowl they provide you a piece of pita on the side. Then you pick your protein, hummus, toppings and dressing options.   I also opted for a small drink ($2) and tried the apple/cinnamon/vanilla and that was good, but I think they should offer that as a hot cider in the winter. I ended up with the blueberry lavender drink and it was light and refreshing.   They do offer cookies as well as canned/bottle beverages as well.   In addition, they have recycling available and have more sustainable silverware available so bonus points there!

3qbCTlbZe6qELWhN56fE8w.text: This is the best fast food Mediterranean restaurant I've ever had!  I love that it's healthy and you have different options to choose from to make it healthier or heartier. The meat is tender and warm. The place is super clean and I love coming here and will keep coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of CAVA - Charlotte, NC, United States

hFJdpNAqFBT4n3BeMv8ITA.text: I tried Cava last night after finding an offer for a free meals  and man was it delicious. The line was long but it moved pretty fast. The free meal offer did not come with any restrictions so I was super excited.   I had no idea what to expect but I was happy to try it. Think of Chipotle with Greek and Mediterranean options. There were so many options it was hard to decide. This place is great if you are vegan or vegetarian.It is located in the Park Road shopping center which made parking pretty easy. The staff was friendly and very helpful.  I got the greens and grains bowl. There were around 6 or more greens to choose from including arugula, spinach, romaine, spring mix etc. I got the romaine with brown basmati rice, braised lamb, chicken, tzatziki sauce, red pepper hummus, feta cheese, carrot and cranberries  mix(I think that is what it was) topped with yogurt fill sauce. The bowl was full to say the least. It also came with a warm pit and I tried the Raspberry Lemonade mix with the Cucumber Mint Lemonade.  In all everything was delicious.   I've already told my friends  and co-workers about it. There is no doubt that I will be a repeat customer.

photos.caption: Photo of CAVA - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of CAVA - Charlotte, NC, United States. Braised lamb &amp; chicken greens and grain bowl !!
Photo of CAVA - Charlotte, NC, United States

ZBoA_0XFdxEloGbXZm47cA.text: Not a bad first visit for me.  I went in with no expectations and found that it is similar to a chipotle style food preparation and service style.  I do appreciate seeing more pay at the counter type places pop up because I want more of these options as it makes quick dinners and takeout much more acceptable, accessible and cheaper especially for singles.  I thought the quality of ingredients here was good not great and the spices used were not my favorite but I prefer Greek over middle eastern so this could be the case even though both styles are similar.  Maybe a bit pricey for what you get but nothing too crazy and you should be full for around $10.  Reasonably healthy if you play it straight.  Nice option In Montford.

OTiruCwmlRcHhOJIy6yv0Q.text: Oh Cava. You have rocked my world. Delicious, healthy, and fresh. I loved my super greens bowl with spicy lamb and roasted veggies. Have fun experimenting with the different spreads and toppings. If you get the lamb, be sure to get the carrots and currant topping, though. The bowl was a little over $10. Fingers crossed that the prices come down a bit.

photos.caption: Photo of CAVA - Charlotte, NC, United States. Super greens with spicy lamb and roasted veggies

GFhrnAvZAlp06MLexWiIRw.text: Cava has become a favorite of mine. I always get the bowl with half supergreens and half brown rice (best of both worlds), pick 3 sauces , protein had a good flavor due to the grill. Best falafels by far! Flavorful and not dry! Tea selection is also fun like the ginger tumeric limeade!

4bETfen0CS04GL0LFfi6uA.text: I LOVE this location. It helps that I live right near it and frequent it but everyone behind the counter is always so pleasant, smiling, and a joy to see each time I come. The wait is never terrible even during busy lunch hours. Can't say enough good - always look forward to seeing the team members when I stop in!

1q_X85PadxDTSQ3WxpemjA.text: This place has plenty of customization options. As much as I appreciate that, I wish it also had a few menu options that were not completely build-from-scratch. The whole experience was rather overwhelming.   As far as food quality goes. It's pretty good, but not great. Yafo is better.

kmE0I6QTRcj7VGjCjwEIDA.text: TLDR: The food is fresh and Mediterranean. The service is fast casual. If you're a fan Mediterranean, Cava is worth the try. Personally, I'm not a fan of Mediterranean--in general--but I've enjoyed every bowl I've had from Cava.

RufWjgsv55bb9NFE3dFyYg.text: Came to the opening of the new location at Park Rd Charlotte. Amazing atmosphere and staff was very welcoming.   I order the salad with half chicken and braised lamb. The chicken and lamb was hot and season very well. My topping was feta cheese, tomatoes & cucumber, pita chips and the sriracha greek yogurt dressing.   Salad was delicious and will definitely order it again

photos.caption: Photo of CAVA - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of CAVA - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of CAVA - Charlotte, NC, United States

ZgsJ-KEegenbrDNUMtX2oQ.text: I really enjoyed Cava it was new and fun! The staff was friendly and helped move us along the line   Great lunch or light dinner place

dSz-TbQZyJrzn2XOB7_7kw.text: Finally, not another pizza place. This place is clean, Brite, and quick. Lots of healthy options at a fair price. Noise level was good. It's Mediterranean, so if you not familiar with this type of food...go try it, you'll be really happly surprised. It's delicious.

pu3KH5kOl5ExsFKdOHrUIA.text: So I'm a huge fan of Mediterranean and fast casual, so I thought I should give this place a try. I must say that I was quite disappointed. The food was cold and the chicken did not have a whole lot of flavor to it. The brown rice was so hard that it felt like I was chewing pebbles. I got a pita on the side and it was cold and tasted like one I could buy in any grocery store. Pretty disappointed. I'll be sticking to YAFO. Much more fresh and flavorful, and they hand make pitas right there.

ZEglMOZLjvus26SZKQ6Bpg.text: So pleasantly surprised! For counter service, really top notch! Fresh, delicious food. Staff was friendly and restaurant was clean. Can't wait for new location to open up near in Waverly.

9J4PTdJHTZ-OWCG8byRBQQ.text: CAVA is my favorite fast casual restaurant right now! The setup is like Chipotle but for Mediterranean food. They have several different options for salad, dips/spreads, protein and toppings. Very light and fresh. I've been several times and have enjoyed every visit!

v_dbax6sUxELdHQd10CtvA.text: I was really excited when I heard CAVA was opening in this location since I live so close. I stopped in last week for lunch but unfortunately, was disappointed. I feel like people have a lot of love for CAVA but the food just underwhelmed me. I will say that the staff were extremely friendly and helpful and the inside is clean and modern. I had a grain bowl with the saffron rice, falafel, hummus, tzatziki, and crazy feta. For toppings I got the cucumber tomato salad, kalamata olives, and onions. The portion for the price overall felt small. There was an OK amount of rice on the bottom but not a lot. The spread portions are also a small scoop, and at similar places/chains the portions of these are much larger. The hummus was OK but it wasn't very flavorful. The falafel were fine but I don't love the style they serve at CAVA. The chick peas are left larger and they feel heavily fried but also weren't crispy, which made them greasy. I was also disappointed in the cucumber and tomato salad because the tomatoes were hardly ripe. They were almost hard to eat. Maybe this was an off experience compared to the norm, but I really prefer Yafo if I'm craving Mediterranean. Their portions are huge and everything is always fresh and in season. I wouldn't run back to CAVA but might consider trying it again in the future.

2Pu_DwuDGHS4l87iAWNLbQ.text: Cava-Park Rd does not disappoint! I had a green/grains bowl with chicken seasonal vegetables! I topped it with "crazy feta", feta crumbles, red pepper hummus, tzatziki sauce, and other things! The drink options were quite tasty. I recommend mixing the cucumber lime and the blueberry lavender teas! The price for the amount of food is quite fair! I have a tomato allergy and I still had ton of food options! I was impressed with the amount of greens they have for you to choose from! Good job.

photos.caption: Photo of CAVA - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of CAVA - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of CAVA - Charlotte, NC, United States

1qzYoOToWgevfsgv-8d3_A.text: I'm mostly writing this review because I had the most pleasant interaction with one of the employees at this location. He helped me and my girlfriend pick what we wanted and was super nice about waiting on us to figure out what everything was. He was super genuine and honestly made our day that much better. Great work guys! The food was per usual pretty good. Lamb is always a good choice with the super greens. Guarantee it will make your bowel movements sing, in a good way.

sCAjBpEmevKuzhQa9Gsu4w.text: The fast casual bowl battle has arrived to Park Road Shopping Center and CAVA aims to make the most of their corner!  Yes, Chopt was here first, but the spicy lamb meatballs might help make CAVA win out. Can only imagine what might happen if YAFO had a location closer than SouthPark.   Kudos for making a colorful, tasty, healthy meal when my wife is going without dairy for a bit...seriously hard to not enjoy some cheese. Also nice that all ingredients are prepared for easy consumption without a knife, so one-handed eating when handling a kid is easy squeezy.   I liked the new spicy lime dressing and pickled onions make me happy with so many different meals. The bright, cool interior could raise your spirits event on a cloudy, hot summer fay at the end of a long week. Nothing crazy going on here, just a tried and True concept that has locations far and wide.

photos.caption: Photo of CAVA - Charlotte, NC, United States

cjjT3DEqZIUPJg-CPZM2iw.text: Fast, no fuss, good food.  Walked in for the first time...confused and the workers quickly gave me the run down of how it works! I buolttmt own bowl and it was really good!   Welcome to the hood!!

5u_n6hijufdxd6n_MaIpAw.text: The lines move quick at cava. At cava you think chipotle the way the line moves you can pick how you want your bowl as well as your protein and dressing. Everything's locally sourced onto your plate.

photos.caption: Photo of CAVA - Charlotte, NC, United States. Build your own bowl

KN57xDH3jiZDDct5X1xiGw.text: I visited this place for the first time recently. I was kind of confused and was rushed through the line pretty fast. I guess it's self explanatory, but I was a little overwhelmed. The line was long and there was a decent wait. I came on a week night around 7 PM.   I ordered the soup and half pita with beef meatballs. The soup was not good. I returned it and they gave me more meatballs. The balls were good, but very pink in the middle. Are they supposed to be? I didn't mind it too much, but would have preferred them to be more cooked. The lemonade and mint drink were delicious. I highly recommend both.   The staff was super nice. They were helpful and caring. I don't know if I would rush back here, but may stop in again sometime.

photos.caption: Photo of CAVA - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of CAVA - Charlotte, NC, United States

5dBPJ6neL9y072dqJzuBuw.text: Fast. Fresh. Fair.  I'm had to please when it comes to fast - Mediterranean food. The flavor has to be present, the presentation has to be colorful, and the food needs to remain fresh and savory even though it's fast-casual.  Cava was a little messy when we went in. It was late in the evening and I'm sure they had just come off a dinner rush, but it could have been swept or tidied up a bit.   The service was great. I was excited to try this new spot and had the highest hopes it would hold a candle to similar local fast-casual spots.   My food was good, not great. I didn't leave craving more of anything specific - I'll give it another try because the harissa was very tasty and the falafel was different from the norm!    I'd vote this as a great lunch spot. Or something quick and easy if you're in the park road area.   Pictured here: I built my own bowl with all the veggies possible! Hubby got the pita with grilled chicken.

photos.caption: Photo of CAVA - Charlotte, NC, United States

JDRLQzhp4emp6TsBp43ObA.text: I swear by this place y'all I'm not even kidding! Cava is a chipotle serving style with Mediterranean cuisine which the best combo IMO. They have practically a limitless amount of options for vegans & vegetarians, but also have a great selection of proteins as well. You start by picking your grain or greens then you pick your hummus then your protein, then your toppings/sauce/dressing. Super fast and convenient, I always use the app because it's quick & I can just run in and pick it up & when you spend a certain amount of $$ you get a free meal.  Staff is always great, never had a problem with them. I have to say one thing that cava stands out for is their environmental support and priorities, all the utensils, bowls, and even straws are biodegradable. All their sodas are non-commercial and organic, and all the juices are made in house with real ingredients.

photos.caption: Photo of CAVA - Charlotte, NC, United States

nDzG7QJ6Wiz_uo2ss-fWxg.text: Who's excited cause there's a Cava open in Southpark? This girl!!!!  I was a little disappointed about this Cava being only 1 level. If you're familiar with the building and the past restaurants that where there (Godfather's Pizza and Fuel) you know there was an upstairs sitting area also. So when I arrived and saw that it was only one level and I was expecting a Super Cava you can imagine my face. The inside however is very nicely decorated. It has a very simple and clean look with black and wood as the main color scheme. The layout makes the tables very accessible and there are tables outside.   I'm in love with the Greens and Grain bowl which is half grain half salad bowl. I always order it to go because I can't finish it. The new seasonal items are amazing. My favorite one is the red pepper chickpea dressing. I normally get the romaine lettuce and the saffron basmati rice. My favorite protein is the lamb meatballs but they are an up charge.   The service is phenomenal. All the employees have been super helpful and very patient especially since I always have like 4 different bowls I'm trying to make at once.   This Cava gets 5 stars from me. I can't wait to see all the seasonal items in store. I see loads of healthy Mediterranean lunches in my future.   Cava  4267 Park Rd Charlotte, NC 28209 October 30, 2018 6:30pm

photos.caption: Photo of CAVA - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of CAVA - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of CAVA - Charlotte, NC, United States

17ckLmxVgYxMLRB0X64VNg.text: This place is good! I'm glad to see one added to the Park Road shopping center. On my most recent visit I opted for the soup and mini pita.   I like that you can mix and match up the options to ensure you get exactly what you want.   I asked for half chicken and half falafel. I loaded up on the toppings! My favorites include the crazy feta and the green harissa.   I want to try everything. I can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of CAVA - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mini Pita

2mT4O9XTb7AdfAmA00iNLA.text: Absolutely loved Cava. It was the preview day so they were slammed packed, but they somehow kept the line moving and the food flowing! Also, despite being so busy staff members still found the time to walk around and make sure people where doing fine and happy with their meals!   This location is pretty easy to find located in park road shopping center. It's middle sized on the inside so during peak times seating may get tough, but not to bad. I went with brown rice and romaine as my base and braised lamb and lamb meatballs as protein. They also have tons of great toppings and sauce options that makes your bowl magical! I'm definitely a fan and will be back soon!

ohrY5wmn1d4Ydh2DmXvrnQ.text: Opening preview night was packed and for good reason. The food was fresh and the service was amazing!   I got the grain/green bowl with falafel & the fresh seasonal vegetables. Loaded with sides and dips! They do not skimp on anything. Also got a hot mini pita to go with my bowl. I also got a side of the grilled meatballs! Delish!     The fresh drinks are delicious. I got the Apple cinnamon vanilla- tasted like fall! Next time I will try the Greek Mediterranean soup! Sounded so good!   It's good for takeout cause they don't have a huge amount of seating. But then again it's food that's fast. So seats open as fast as they are filled. Don't be fooled by a long line here, it's worth the wait. They are efficient and have a great system!   I love the concept of Cava the fresh healthy Mediterranean option! They have a list of GF/DF and other allergy info. All nutritional value info is posted as well.   Thank you to the staff that worked so hard to provide the fresh food for us. Everything is sourced locally which is also amazing that they give back!

photos.caption: Photo of CAVA - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of CAVA - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of CAVA - Charlotte, NC, United States

aDJkVOQZhrbzghDYc6m1EQ.text: This is like a Cava tradition for me, my second time being the first to review Cava in Charlotte lol.   I love this place so much and the staff as well as the food is great! Today they had the preview meal day and guest had the opportunity to enjoy an assortment of Mediterranean options. You select your green, grains and toppings oh and don't forget the awesome in-house pita chips.   This new CLT cava is located near Firestone and Harris Teeter in the Park Road Shopping Center. The architectural work is great and from the outside it looks as if it's two levels but it's not.  What I love the most about Cava is the way they give back to the community. During community day they offer free dinner to the community in exchange for donations that will benefit a local farming non profit. All proceeds raised will be donated to Sow Much Good!  Check out Cava you won't be disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of CAVA - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of CAVA - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of CAVA - Charlotte, NC, United States

doRX2DjVid7k0FQbxtotuw.text: We tried to come here the day before they opened when they were giving away free meals, but the love was wrapped around the building. We came back for a team lunch a few days later.   We didn't get there until about 12:30 and it was crowded. The love moved fast, but the restaurant is not made for a lot of people. It's very loud and there isn't very much seating. We had a group of 7 and we were able to find a table, but we had to split up. You also can't move the tables, so the largest group that can sit together is 4.   As for the food -- it's a build your own Mediterranean style restaurant (think Chipotle). It's similar to Yafo. There are no suggested options.   You can get a bowl or pita and do a salad or grain base. I did a salad base with SplendidGreens. It was a mix of kale and Brussels sprouts (and something else I can't remember). You get one protein -- I picked spicy lamb meatballs (there's an upcharge)  You get three sauces and I got roasted red pepper hummus, harissa, and crazy feta. You get as many toppings as you want and I got all except olives and lettuce (and they were out of the seasonal veggies). You then finish with one dressing and I got lemon herb tahini. They also gave me pita with my bowl.   Overall, I really liked it. The lamb meatballs were delicious, but I wish they gave you more than 4 small meatballs. I probably wouldn't get harissa again because while it was good, the spice overtook the flavor of the whole bowl. I loved the SplendidGreens base. Much more unique than your normal salad base.   The drink options are really good. They make their own sodas, but I went for the lemonades. I mixed the cucumber lime mint with the classic lemonade.   Overall, I think I like Yafo better, but it's definitely close. I think Cava has better choices for your base.   I really enjoyed my meal and I would come back again, but either with a smaller group or I would get it to go.

photos.caption: Photo of CAVA - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of CAVA - Charlotte, NC, United States. SpendidGreens w/roasted red pepper hummus, harissa, crazy feta, spicy lamb meatballs, all toppings minus olives/lettuce, &amp; lemon herb tahini
Photo of CAVA - Charlotte, NC, United States

1m9YKyq-hdt8sBhrS7K5zA.text: I had heard great things about cava but had never been. I'm so glad I found out that this location would be opening AND that the food would be FREE. If that hadn't been the case, I would have kept putting it off.   Anyway, despite being fairly busy for their lunchtime preview, it was a good experience. Like everyone says, it's like the Greek version of Chipotle with way more options. My bowl was delicious. I really loved the feta dip and wish I had gotten 3 scoops of that instead of the red pepper eggplant and roasted red pepper dip. The bowl was filling. Also, their drinks were good. The staff were very friendly and parking at that time was no problem.   I would go again. The only thing that would keep me from going every day is the price. :-)

photos.caption: Photo of CAVA - Charlotte, NC, United States

0w0TFs9xPKzbc394Ditgqw.text: Hailing from Potomac, MD I was THRILLED when I found out my favorite neighborhood greek restaurant would be opening one of their fast casual grill concepts here in Charlotte!   The people that work at this location are always friendly and ingredients are always fresh.   My order is fairly consist, I always get the super greens (a mix of kale and shaved brussel sprouts), lentils, and brown rice. At this point they also ask you if you want a warm mini pita (I'm gluten free ... but if you aren't... they are good). Then you add on three dips: hummus, eggplant and red pepper, and tzatziki. Then you choose your protein I used to always get falafel, but sadly they are binded with a gluten so I've switched to the seasonal roasted veggies. Then you get to add all the toppings: I get extra red cabbage, tomatoes and cucumber, kalamata olives, and feta.  I crave this all. the. time. I'm there pretty regularly!   Try their custom drink combos! They are delish!

lNr3bNk29MP8qdsFlW3dRw.text: I ate at CAVA in NJ all the time and always had my bowl filled perfectly(Full Bowl). While bowls at this location are filled "Half Way", for some reasons employees here will give you only one tea spoon in any toppings you ask. What is with this saving, I wonder if they are being pressured by the management. It makes one feel uncomfortable having to ask for more for each filling. Employees should know better than leaving bowls half way empty. For the amount of money customers are paying, they shouldn't leave on an empty stomach.

G05h4i-qHSZ-64s7l58M9A.text: Cava was delicious! I went on a Friday evening and the venue was very modern and nice, and there was not a long wait. We received great service and they really took the time to explain to us the ingredients that we did not know about. The food was really good, only downside was that the portion size was a little small. I was still hungry afterwards.

RCCSV7JdhZwI4tn6teWavw.text: It's ok. The flavors are lacking. It's like somebody forgot to add salt. The rice isn't really good. They should switch to jasmine versus the basmati. This is REALLLLY American Mediterranean fast food. YAFO is far better.

85MZlcV-zQmb6zikSnwinw.text: Created the best bowl ever! Ordered online so I could have time to figure out what I wanted. Perfect bowl consists of:  1/2 super greens 1/2 lentils Spicy lamb meatballs Spicy harissa Roasted red pepper hummus Tzaziki Feta Pickled onions Cucumber and tomatoes Cabbage slaw Banana peppers Pearl couscous Cauliflower quinoa tabbouleh (missing in my bowl) Fresh mint (also think this was missing) Crispy pita strips   Green harissa and sriracha yogurt on the side. Only complaint is it's a pretty light bowl. Could probably load you up more on the base or toppings. Also, online ordering seems to not be completely accurate. My order through the app is slightly different from what was printed on the receipt/order.

K2HPoQv4cTyOrIO8O4M-1w.text: So I came to this location for their grand opening and it was great but that is to be expected with everyone being new and corporate being there. Since then I've been back 3 times, two of the times were meh just due to lack of friendliness and it being more of a get in get out experience. This last time on Sunday made this my last time coming to this location, I will just go to the University location when I'm on that side even though this is closer to me.   On Sunday upon walking in I was greeted this time by a worker wiping down tables. I went to the counter to start my order, the employee for the line was chatting with the cashier and slowing came over. I started my order and when I got to protein I asked to verify if I got half braised lamb & half lamb meatballs would u be charged $1.45 twice. He started no. I also remember someone asking the day of the opening but just wanted to me sure I usually just get one of them but wanted both this time. When I got to the register the cashier wasn't they so he rang me up. When I seen my receipt I seen I was charged twice & asked about it. He responded oh guess I was wrong, the cashier was walking back up & he asked her & she said yep that's how it's charged. They said they would get a manger after going back & forth but I was in a rush. When I got in the car I decided to call & asked for the manager, when she got in the phone she talked fast with an attitude that I couldn't get her name. I proceed to say hello like 6 times because the phone got silent (I'm assuming she muted the phone to talk to the employees). She got back on the phone and said hello again very rudely. At this point I'm over it so I just ask about the charge and she responded yep that's how it's rung up and then proceed to hang up.  So I decided to call the university location and they confirmed it should be only one charge. And I also tried it online and you only get charged once as well.  Either they like overcharging customers or they don't own up to simple mistakes either way they won't get my money again.
